src:
Aston Villa attendances - How Villa Park crowds stack up against Premier League rivals
Aston Villa latest news | Here's how the Villa Park crowds rank among the Premier League following Villa's return to the top flight following promotion from the Championship.
01 Nov 2019, 18:39 by Mark Wakefield, Jamie Kemble, Richard Cusack
Aston Villa are back in Premier League action this weekend.
And they return to Villa Park for a home clash with unbeaten leaders Liverpool.
It's set to be yet another full house at B6, as it has been all season so far.
Aston Villa latest
This is your round up of all things Villa; the one-stop shop that will keep you updated on the latest goings on at the club and beyond.
Transfers, injuries, match-days and managers, we’ve got you covered.
We’ll be bringing the very latest on the Villains throughout the week and around the clock.
Make sure you keep yourself updated with our handy daily catch up...



 
Must reads...

The injury latest on Aston Villa star Jack Grealish - READ
The team Dean Smith should pick against Wolves - READ
Darren Bent's message to young striker Keinan Davis - READ
The referee announced for Liverpool at Villa Park - READ
The amazing sausage sandwich story Aston Villa fans will love - READ


For all your latest AVFC news, opinion, analysis and transfer gossip, click here

You can follow our Villa reporter Ashley Preece on Twitter, and his email address is Ashley.Preece@reachplc.com.
 
But how do Villa's crowds stack up against their rivals, often a much-debated statistic among rival fans?

Read on for the full figures...

THE AVERAGE ATTENDANCES
1 Manchester United 73,540
2 Arsenal 60,309
3 West Ham United 59,909
4 Tottenham Hotspur 59,572
5 Manchester City 54,420
6 Liverpool 52,820
7 Newcastle United 46,473

8 Aston Villa 41,660

9 Chelsea 40,604
10 Everton 39,255
11 Leicester City 32,006
12 Wolverhampton Wanderers 30,999
13 Sheffield United 30,762
14 Southampton 30,522
15 Brighton & Hove Albion 30,203
16 Norwich City 27,055
17 Crystal Palace 25,251
18 Watford 20,615
19 Burnley 20,576
20 AFC Bournemouth 10,602
 
THE HIGHEST ATTENDANCES
1 Manchester United 73,737
2 Tottenham Hotspur 60,407
3 Arsenal 60,345
4 West Ham United 59,950
5 Manchester City 54,506
6 Liverpool 53,333
7 Newcastle United 51,198

8 Aston Villa 42,010

9 Chelsea 40,683
10 Everton 39,374
11 Leicester City 32,168
12 Sheffield United 31,774
13 Southampton 31,712
14 Wolverhampton Wanderers 31,534
15 Brighton & Hove Albion 30,610
16 Norwich City 27,108
17 Crystal Palace 25,480
18 Burnley 21,762
19 Watford 21,360
20 AFC Bournemouth 10,729

You can find the average and maximum attendances tables in full here.

VILLA'S HOME ATTENDANCES (LEAGUE)
Bournemouth - 40996
Everton - 41,922
West Ham - 42,010
Burnley - 41,546
Brighton - 41,826
CAPACITY
The capacity is widely listed as 42,785.
